poem:
### Digital Bandits

From the din of wireless whispers,  
phantom fingers tap the screen,  
turning trust to dust—  
a swarm of lies in flight,  
bypassing barriers like specters  
through firewalls, haunting  
pockets and palms,  
as chaos spreads its silent  
signal, sparking disbelief  
in the heart of connection—  
beware the masked marauders  
of this new invisible world.
